The Return of the Living Dead
when Foreman Frank shows new employee
Freddie a secret military experiment in
a Supply Warehouse the two klutzes
accidentally release a gas that
reanimates corpses into flesh-eating
zombies as the epidemic spreads
throughout Louisville Kentucky and the
creatures satisfy their hunger and gory
and outlandish ways Frank and Freddie
fight to survive with the help of their
boss and a mysterious mortician starring
clue Gallagher James Karen Don kalfa and
directed by Dan O'Bannon critics say a
punk take on the zombie genre The Return
of the Living Dead injects a healthy
dose of 80 silliness to the flesh
consuming

number nine The Dead Zone
when Johnny Smith awakens from a coma
caused by a car accident he finds that
years have passed and he now has psychic
abilities heartbroken that his
girlfriend has moved on with her life
Johnny also must contend with his
unsettling Powers which allow him to see
a person's future with a mere touch
after shaking the hand of aspiring
politician Greg Stillson Johnny sees a
danger presented by the candidates rise
and resolves to kill him starring
Christopher Walken Brooke Adams Tom
scarrett and directed by David
Cronenberg critics say The Dead Zone
combines taught direction from David
Cronenberg and a rich performance from
Christopher Walken to create one of the
strongest Stephen King adaptations

number eight Little Shop of Horrors Meek
flower shop assistant Seymour Pines for
co-worker Audrey during a total eclipse
he discovers an unusual plant he names
Audrey too which feeds only on human
flesh and blood the growing plant
attracts a great deal of business for
the previously struggling store after
Seymour feeds Audrey's boyfriend Oren to
the plant after Oren's accidental death
he must come up with more bodies for the
increasingly bloodthirsty plan starring
Rick Moranis Ellen Greene Steve Martin
and directed by Frank Oz critics say
remixing Roger corman's B-movie by way
of the Off-Broadway musical Little Shop
of Horrors offers Camp horror and catchy
Tunes in equal measure plus some
inspired cameos by the likes of Steve
Martin and Bill Murray damn thorns

number seven The Shining
Jack Torrance becomes winter caretaker
at the isolated Overlook Hotel in
Colorado hoping to cure his writer's
block he settles in along with his wife
Wendy and his son Danny who is plagued
by psychic premonitions as Jack's
writing goes nowhere and Danny's Visions
become more disturbing Jack discovers a
hotel's dark secrets and begins to
unravel into a homicidal maniac
hell-bent on terrorizing his own family
starring Jack Nicholson Shelley Duvall
Danny Lloyd and directed by Stanley
Kubrick critics say though it deviates
from Stephen King's novel Stanley
Kubrick's The Shining is a chilling
often Baroque journey into Madness
exemplified by an unforgettable turn
from Jack Nicholson

number five the fly
when scientists Seth brundle completes
his teleportation device he decides to
test its abilities on himself now
unbeknownst to him a housefly slips in
during the process leading to a merger
of man and insect initially brundle
appears to have undergone a successful
teleportation but the fly cells begin to
take over his body as he becomes
increasingly fly like brundle's
girlfriend is horrified I mean I would
be too as the person she once loved
deteriorates into a monster starring
Jeff Goldblum Gina Davis John Getz and
directed by David Cronenberg critics say
David Cronenberg combines his trademark
affinity for Gore and horror which
strongly develop characters making the
fly a surprisingly affecting tragedy

number four Evil Dead 2.
the second of three films in the Evil
Dead series is part horror part comedy
with Ash Williams once again battling
horrifying demons at a secluded Cabin in
the Woods After discovering an audio
tape left by a college professor that
contains voices reading from The Book of
the Dead Ash's girlfriend Linda becomes
possessed by evil spirits that are
awakened by the voices on the tape now
Ash soon discovers there is no escaping
the woods starring Bruce Campbell Sarah
Berry Dan Hicks and directed by Sam
Rainey critics say Evil Dead twos
increase special effects and slapstick
Gore makes it as good if not better than
the original

number three A Nightmare on Elm Street
in Wes Craven's classic slasher films
several Midwestern teenagers fall prey
to Freddy Krueger a disfigured midnight
Mangler who preys on the teenagers in
their dreams which in turn kills them in
reality after investigating the
phenomenon Nancy begins to suspect that
a dark secret kept by her and her
friend's parents may be the key to
unraveling the mystery but can Nancy and
her boyfriend Glenn solve the puzzle
before it's too late starring Robert
Englund Heather langenkamp John Saxton
and directed by Wes Craven critics say
Wes Craven's intelligent premise
combined with the horrifying visual
appearance of Freddy Krueger still
causes nightmares to this day in a
Nightmare on Elm Street

this classic low budget horror film
combines just the right amount of Gore
and black humor giving the Evil Dead an
equal amount of Thrills and laughs to

the thing
in remote Antarctica a group of American
Research scientists are Disturbed at
their base camp by a helicopter shooting
at a sled dog now when they take in the
dog it brutally attacks both human
beings and canines in the camp and they
discover that the Beast can assume the
shape of its victims a resourceful
helicopter pilot and a camp doctor lead
the camp crew in a desperate gory battle
against a vicious creature before it
picks them all off one by one starring
Kurt Russell Wilford Brimley TK Carter
and directed by John Carpenter critics
say grammar and more terrifying than the
1950s take John Carpenter's The Thing is
a tense sci-fi thriller Rife with
compelling tension and some remarkable
makeup effects

Beetlejuice
Beetlejuice Beetlejuice beetlejuice
after Barbara and Adam Maitland die in a
car accident they find themselves stuck
haunting their country residents unable
to leave the house when the unbearable
dietzes and teen daughter Lydia by the
Home the mate lands attempt to scare
them away without success their efforts
attract Beetlejuice a rambunctious
Spirit whose help quickly becomes
dangerous for the mate lands and
innocent Lydia starring Michael Keaton
Winona Ryder Alec Baldwin and directed
by Tim Burton critics say brilliantly
bizarre and overflowing with ideas
Beetlejuice offers some of Michael
Keaton's most deliciously manic work and
creepy funny fun for the whole family

Poltergeist
strange and creepy happenings beset and
average California family the freelings
Steve Diane teenage Dana eight-year-old
Robbie and five-year-old Carol Ann when
ghosts commune with them through the
television set initially friendly and
playful the spirits turn unexpectedly
menacing and when Carol Ann goes missing
Steve and Diane turn to a
parapsychologist and eventually an
exorcist for help starring Craig T
Nelson JoBeth Williams Beatrice straight
and directed by Toby Hooper critics say
smartly filmed tightly scripted and most
importantly consistently frightening
Poltergeist is a modern horror classic

and finally number one aliens
after floating in space for 57 years
Lieutenant Ripley's shuttle is found by
a deep space Salvage team upon arriving
at LV 426 the Marines find only one
Survivor a nine-year-old girl named Newt
but even these battle-hardened marines
with all the latest Weaponry are no
match for the hundreds of aliens that
have invaded the colony starring
Sigourney Weaver Carrie Hen Michael bean
and directed by James Cameron critics
say while alien was a Marvel of slow
building atmospheric tension aliens
packs a much more visceral punch and
features a typically strong performance
from Sigourney Weaver
